Description: Pottery lid in an orange-pink ware, roughly made disc, flat with chamfered edge and rounded central knob. Raised radial lines on the upper surface. Pitch or similar material around the rim.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), south rampart street section A level 3B
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Excavation no. QI 78321/18 (= Qasr Ibrim Day no. [19]78.3.21/18). Donated: Egypt Exploration Society. Excavated at Qasr Ibrim. Date: not listed in Adams 1996, but material with 'Day numbers' close to ours are of the Late Christian I Period, c. AD 1100-1300.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3613)
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
